Unit.$comment: The name or number of the unit within a site

BuildingNumber.$comment: The number of a building or house on a street of this address.

BuildingName.$comment: The name of the building or house on a street of this address

ComplexName.$comment: Where the address is within a complex, scheme or site, the name of the complex

StreetName.$comment: Name of a street or thoroughfare

CitySubDivision.$comment: A text string identifying a division of a city, for example a local authority area, district or borough.

CityName.$comment: The name of the city, town or village of this address.

CountrySubentityName.$comment: The name that identifies the territorial division (a chief unit of local administration) of a country, as part of an address, For example a UK County, or a US State etc.

Country.$comment:
To provide country information related to this address.

The country of the address (not the country code)

PostalCode.$comment: The identifier for one or more properties according to the postal service of that country; a group of letters and/or numbers added to the postal address to assist in the sorting of mail. E.g. UK postcode or US zip code

AnswerNarrative.$comment: Where the type is Narrative, the narrative answer provided by the referrer (may also be provided in the AnswerAttachment or supported by the AnswerAttachment).

AnswerNumeric.$comment: Where the type is Numeric, the single number provided as the answer

AnswerYesNo.$comment: Where the type is Yes/No, true for yes or false for no.

AnswerDate.$comment: Where the type is Date, the single date provided as the answer

Description.$comment: Explains what this question is, and should be used to provide guidance or additional information to the person answering the question.

Type.$comment: Identifies the type of criterion so that the presentation of the questions, collection of the answer, and assesment of whether or not the answer meets the criterion can be completed.

MinimumNumeric.$comment: For numeric type criterion, specifies the minimum number that meets this criterion.

MaximumNumeric.$comment: For numeric type criterion, specifies the maximum number that meets this criterion.

MinimumDate.$comment: For date type criterion, specifies the earliest date that meets this criterion.

MaximumDate.$comment: For date type criterion, specifies the latest date that meets this criterion.

Date.$comment: The date that the referral was sent from the referrer to the service provider.

SelfReferred.$comment: Indicates whether or not the Service User self-referred, or whether someone else referred them

Name.$comment: The name of the service (given by the Service Provider)

items.$comment: Identifies the types of action that are provided by this service.
Identifies the need types that this service is intended to provide care and support for

AnswerNarrative.$comment: Where the type is Narrative, the narrative answer provided by the referrer (may also be provided in the AnswerAttachment or supported by the AnswerAttachment).

AnswerNumeric.$comment: Where the type is Numeric, the single number provided as the answer

AnswerYesNo.$comment: Where the type is Yes/No, true for yes or false for no.

AnswerDate.$comment: Where the type is Date, the single date provided as the answer

Description.$comment: Explains what this question is, and should be used to provide guidance or additional information to the person answering the question.

Type.$comment: Identifies the type of criterion so that the presentation of the questions, collection of the answer, and assesment of whether or not the answer meets the criterion can be completed.

MinimumNumeric.$comment: For numeric type criterion, specifies the minimum number that meets this criterion.

MaximumNumeric.$comment: For numeric type criterion, specifies the maximum number that meets this criterion.

MinimumDate.$comment: For date type criterion, specifies the earliest date that meets this criterion.

MaximumDate.$comment: For date type criterion, specifies the latest date that meets this criterion.

AdditionalInformation.$comment: Additional qualifying information about the consent, for example who they have consented to share information with

NoticeText.$comment: The text of the notice that has been consented to. Mayb be used instead of the Notice attachment.

GivenOrRefused.$comment: Whether this consent type has been given or refused.

ConsentType.$comment: The type of consent given or requested

DateTimeGivenOrRefused.$comment: The date that this consent was given or refused. This can be used to sequence consent and establish whether or not a consetn was in place at a particular point in time.

Statement.$comment: The declaration itself that is being made or not made, for example "I declare that neither I or my family work for the service provider or any affiliated company".

Declared.$comment: Indicates if this declaration was made (true) or declined (false). If this attribute is omitted, it should be understood that the declaration was neither made nor declined.

Filename.$comment: The file system name of the file that is attached - used as the default or suggested name if the file is 'saved'.

AsOfDate.$comment: The last date for which the information in the attachment has been verified to be current. Also the effective date, for example the date a photograph was taken.

CreationDateTime.$comment: Date and time a document or attachment was created

URI.$comment: If the attachment is available via a link, the uniform resource identifier (URI) of the attachment. This may be a public link, or a private link to which the recipient has access.

Title.$comment: Title or caption for the attached file or document

EmbeddedFileBinaryObject.$comment: An electronic representation of the attachment encoded into text using Base64 content encoding. For more details on this encoding, see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Base64

Description.$comment: A description of the contents of the attached file or document to help a reader establish if this is the correct file before opening

CopyrightNotices.$comment: Text description of any legal or copyright notices that may apply to the file in question

Met.$comment: When used in the context of specific Service User(s), indicates whether this criterion is met or not by the Service User(s) in the opinion of the referrer.

Comments.$comment: Specific details related to this alert - for example what specifically to be aware of, or sensible precautions to take.

Type.$comment: This provides the specific type of alert that is being flagged, e.g. 'don't visit alone'. NOTE: These alert types and associated comments must not be repeated verbatim on an operatives work order for privacy reasons. Only the information that is essential to the performance of the operatives work should be included, which may be  abstracted or summarized from the details found in the AlertRegardingPerson entity.

DisabilitiesOrExtraCareNeeds.$comment: A narrative description of any disabilities or extra care needs

OtherDescription.$comment: If type is 'other', then describe what this income or expenditure is

IncomeOrExpenditureType.$comment: The type of this income or expenditure, or other

IncomeOrExpenditure.$comment: Indicates whether this is income or expenditure

AmountBasis.$comment: Indicates whether this is income or expenditure

Periodicity.$comment: Periodicity of amount - weekly, monthly, annually etc.

Gender.$comment: A code indicating the self-identified gender of a person

OtherGender.$comment: Where Gender is 'Other', the self-identified Gender of the Person.

MaritalCode.$comment: To specify  whether this person is married, single, or divorced.

BirthDate.$comment:
To specify the date or date time of the birth of this person.

The date of birth

Sex.$comment: A code indicating the biological sex of a person, including options for not specified or not known

Age.$comment: To specify any age measure related to this person such as his/her age at a particular point in time.

Citizenship.$comment: The country in which this person is legally a citizen

CapacityType.$comment: Determines the capacity in which the specified person is acting on behalf of the subject

FromDate.$comment: The date from which the power was or will be granted

ToDate.$comment: The date on which the power ceases to be granted, if applicable

DateTime.$comment: The date and time that the review of the file took place

Comments.$comment: Any comments made by the reviewer

DateTime.$comment: The date and time that these scores were established - i.e. the date and time that the information was collected from the subject or that any test or assessment was conducted.

PreviousDateTime.$comment: The date and time that the previous scores provided were established.

Description.$comment: A narrative description of what these scores are, including information about the previous scores.

Name.$comment: The name of the score, question that was asked or axes on which this score occurs

CurrentScore.$comment: The current or latest score (often this is the only score provided unless a comparative score is provided). This will typically be numeric, but other gradings - e.g. A-F - are also allowed).

Minimum.$comment: The minimum possible score or rating - used for creating axes. If omitted, 0 should be assumed.

Maximum.$comment: The maximum possible score or rating - used for creating axes

Years.$comment: The number of complete years in this duration. When calculating an end date by adding this duration to a start date, the number of years are added first, before any other duration attributes.

Months.$comment: The number of complete months in this duration. When calculating an end date by adding this duration to a start date, the number of years are added first, then the number of months, before any other duration attributes.

Weeks.$comment: The number of complete weeks in this duration. When calculating an end date by adding this duration to a start date, the number of years are added first, then the months, then the weeks, before any other duration attributes.

Days.$comment: The number of complete days in this duration. When calculating an end date by adding this duration to a start date, the number of years are added first, then the months, then weeks, then days, before any other duration attributes.

Hours.$comment: The number of complete hours in this duration. When calculating an end date by adding this duration to a start date, the number of years are added first, then the months, then weeks, then days, then hours, before any other duration attributes.

Minutes.$comment: The number of complete minutes in this duration. When calculating an end date by adding this duration to a start date, the number of years are added first, then the months, then weeks, then days, then hours, then minutes, before any other duration attributes.

Type.$comment: The type of the category that this categorization belongs to, e.g. "Portfolio", "Country", or "RICS Red Book"

Category.$comment: The category value of this categorization, e.g. "Class A Offices", or "Canada"

AllocatedBy.$comment: An identifier of the organization and system that allocated this category - this could be the name of the organization and/or system or something that identifies the specific instance of a system or database where the category originated.

VersionUsed.$comment: If applicable, the version or edition of the categorization used e.g. for RICS Red Book categorizations this may contain the edition: "2015 Edition"

SubCategory.$comment: If applicable, the sub-category of this categorization (i.e. a subcategory within the 'Category' chosen above)

items.$comment: Specifies what kind of communication or interaction this action item will require - for example a home visit ('in person - at customer location'), phone call or text message

FulfillmentMethodCode.$comment: Classifies whether this actino will be fulfilled internally or via a referral

ActualOutcomeCode.$comment: Classifies the actual outcome of this action item to allow the action item to be classified for reporting and analysis purposes

ActionType.$comment: Identifies the type of action that is to be undertaken to address the corresponding need

Name.$comment:
The full name of this organization

To specify any name related to this organization.

Role.$comment: This is a text field to describe the role of the party, only used with Other_Party.

Unit.$comment: The name or number of the unit within a site

BuildingNumber.$comment: The number of a building or house on a street of this address.

BuildingName.$comment: The name of the building or house on a street of this address

ComplexName.$comment: Where the address is within a complex, scheme or site, the name of the complex

StreetName.$comment: Name of a street or thoroughfare

CitySubDivision.$comment: A text string identifying a division of a city, for example a local authority area, district or borough.

CityName.$comment: The name of the city, town or village of this address.

CountrySubentityName.$comment: The name that identifies the territorial division (a chief unit of local administration) of a country, as part of an address, For example a UK County, or a US State etc.

Country.$comment:
To provide country information related to this address.

The country of the address (not the country code)

PostalCode.$comment: The identifier for one or more properties according to the postal service of that country; a group of letters and/or numbers added to the postal address to assist in the sorting of mail. E.g. UK postcode or US zip code

PreferredChannel.$comment: Indicates the preferred technology or platform - for example mobile phone, email, social media

PreferredMedium.$comment: Indicates the preferred medium or mode of communication - for example, written (e.g. text) or audio (e.g. call)

PreferredDaysAndTimesForContact.$comment: Narrative description of the preferred days and times for contact

Medium.$comment: Specifies whether the medium of communication is text, audio, video or other.

Code.$comment: Identifies the technology that is used for the communication, e.g. telephone or social media.

Value.$comment: The value or address of the communication channel (e.g. phone number, email address,etc.)

InterpreterOrTranslatorPresent.$comment: Indicates whether this communication involves a translator or interpreter. This should be true if a third party was used specifically to translate or interpret between the two or more people communicating. When a person who is involved in the communication is speaking for themselves but not in their native or preferred language, that does not indicate translation or interpretation. However, if the communication involves several people, and one person participating in the communication translates or interprets for another - even if the person translating or interpreting is not present specifically for that purpose - this should be noted as an interpreter or translator present.

InterpreterOrTranslator.$comment: If an interpreter or translator was present - even if it was someone who was not present specifically for that purpose - then this describes who the intepreter or translator was. This may be a name or a service (e.g. 'Language Line').

Description.$comment: Free text to provide further details about the Communication

NotAvailable.$comment: Optional indicator to record that this commuication channel is not available. For example, to indicate that a particular person does not have an email address or modibe phone. This can be used to prevent the person being repeatedly asked to provide contact details they don't hvae.

ID.$comment: The actual reference number or string used to identify a particular entity in a system or process.

AllocatedByCode.$comment: The role of the organization that has allocated the Reference.

AllocatedBy.$comment: An identifier of the organization and/or system that allocated this identifier - this could be the name of the organization and/or system or something that identifies the specific instance of a system or database where the ID originated.

Full.$comment: A string of characters providing a name or set of names by which this person is known

Given.$comment: Name or names, usually given to a person by his/her parents at birth, also known as forename, first name or Christian name.

Family.$comment: The name a person shares with members of his/her family, also known as surname.

FamilyPrefix.$comment: The textual description of any prefix that precedes this person's family name such as van, von etc. (Fred Van Blommestein).

Initials.$comment: Generally in the form of a set of the initial letters of the Given and Middle names, optionally space-delimited.

Title.$comment: The textual description of any title associated with a specific person such as Dr.,  Ir. etc.

Middle.$comment: Name or names, usually given to a person by his/her parents at birth, other than the first name.

Date.$comment: The effective date of this plan

Name.$comment: The action plan name is used to distinguish multiple *concurrent* plans that may be in effect. This may be the case if part of the action plan is being supported under a specific program whose funding is contingent on being able to demonstrate specific criteria have been met in the way the case is being handled.

CustomerSignedOff.$comment: Indicates whether or not the customer (service user) has signed off this action plan.

CustomerSignedOffDate.$comment: If the customer (service user) has reviewed and signed this action plan, record the date on which this happened.

Active.$comment: Indicates if this plan is actively being deelivered or if it has been retired and is no longer being actioned.

Why.$comment: Why the content was shared - for what purpose and/or in what capacity the recipient is acting.

Status.$comment: The actual status - red (R), amber (A) or green (G)

Date.$comment: The date (and time if appropriate) that this status was assigned. This is useful if a history of status changes are kept because it allows them to be sequenced, and the most recent identified.

Comments.$comment: Any comments made by the person assigning the status, perhaps to summarize why the status was assigned.

Type.$comment: Specifies the nature of the dependency between items - for example the dependent item cannot start until the item it depends on is complete.

ItemName.$comment: A short name for the action - usually a few words or very short sentence.

EstimatedCompletionDate.$comment: The date (and time if approriate) by which it is expected that this action item will be completed. Also known as the Target Date.

Deadline.$comment: If applicable, an extrinsic date by which this action item must be completed to avoid some adverse consequence.

DeadlineReason.$comment: A narrative description of why the deadline date applies - for example the date of a court hearing or effective date of an eviction notice.

Status.$comment: Describes the action item lifecycle status

NewStatus.$comment: The new status after the change

DateTime.$comment: The date and time that this status change occurred

Comment.$comment: A free form text field that contains the notations relevant to the Work Order

CommentDateTime.$comment: The date and time that the Work Order comment was created

FrequencyCode.$comment: The time period used to measure the interval between events

IntervalCount.$comment: The number of intervals (specified by Frequency Code) between events. If this is omitted, it is assumed to be 1. For example, if the Frequency code is "70" (quarterly) and this attribute is omitted, it is assumed that the event occurs every quarter, where as if this attribute was present with a value of 3, it would mean the event occurs once every 3 quarters.

items.$comment: Optionally specifies which day or days of the week this event should be occur on. If multiple days are selected, it is understood that the event occurs on *every* day. For example, a frequency of weekly and day of the week codes for Tuesday and Thursday would mean the event takes place on every Tuesday and every Thursday.

StartDate.$comment: The date (and time if appropriate) of the first instance, inclusive.

EndDate.$comment: The date (and time if appropriate) of the last instance, or after which no more instances will be required. If this is omitted, it is understood to indicate that the event continues indefinitely.

StartTime.$comment: Specifies the time of day that each instance starts.

TypeCode.$comment: Identifies the type of this specific risk

OtherType.$comment: If the TypeCode is an 'other' codes specify the type of of this item here. This should be a few word summary - details can be provided elsewhere.

Description.$comment: Optionally provide additional information or comments about this assessed item

LevelCode.$comment: Identifies the level of this particular item (risk, need etc.) on a simple scale from none to high.

DateTime.$comment: The date and time that this risk or need was assessed and identified

StatutoryOrVoluntaryInterventions.$comment: A description of other interventions that the service user themselves have voluntarily engaged with or that have been imposed on them, for example court orders ot voluntary treatements.

DateTime.$comment: The date and time that this analysis was completed

Details.$comment: A narrative description of the analysis, including specific details, the frequency etc.

ServiceUserViews.$comment: Narrative to record the service user view about this analysis as appropriate.

Actors.$comment: A narrative description of the actors involved in this case, whether their role is as a potential cause of the risk or need, or the subject of a risk or need. This is narrative to accommodate the specific persons being unknown or non-specific (for example family members or neighbours)

TriggerFactors.$comment: A narrative description of current or previous factors that can trigger the risk or need.

DateTime.$comment: The date and time that this assessment was completed

TypeCode.$comment: Identifies the type of this specific need

OtherType.$comment: If the TypeCode is an 'other' codes specify the type of of this item here. This should be a few word summary - details can be provided elsewhere.

Description.$comment: Optionally provide additional information or comments about this assessed item

LevelCode.$comment: Identifies the level of this particular item (risk, need etc.) on a simple scale from none to high.

DateTime.$comment: The date and time that this risk or need was assessed and identified
The date and time that this analysis was completed

Details.$comment: A narrative description of the analysis, including specific details, the frequency etc.

ServiceUserViews.$comment: Narrative to record the service user view about this analysis as appropriate.

Actors.$comment: A narrative description of the actors involved in this case, whether their role is as a potential cause of the risk or need, or the subject of a risk or need. This is narrative to accommodate the specific persons being unknown or non-specific (for example family members or neighbours)

TriggerFactors.$comment: A narrative description of current or previous factors that can trigger the risk or need.

DateTime.$comment: The date and time that this assessment was completed

Accepted.$comment: Indicates whether the referral is accepted (true) or declined (false)

DeclineReason.$comment: If the referral is declined, thisis a narrative description of why it has been declined.

ServiceCommencementDate.$comment: The date on which the service will start. This may be a definite date or an estimated date as specified in the ServiceCommencementDateType

ServiceCommencementDateCertainty.$comment: Specifies whether the commencement date given is an actual known date or an estimate.

ExpectedNextSteps.$comment: A narrative description of what the service user and/or referrer can expect to happen next.

RelatedAreaOfNeed.$comment: A top level classifiction of which underlying top-level need type this document is related to.

Filename.$comment: The file system name of the file that is attached - used as the default or suggested name if the file is 'saved'.

AsOfDate.$comment: The last date for which the information in the attachment has been verified to be current. Also the effective date, for example the date a photograph was taken.

CreationDateTime.$comment: Date and time a document or attachment was created

URI.$comment: If the attachment is available via a link, the uniform resource identifier (URI) of the attachment. This may be a public link, or a private link to which the recipient has access.

Title.$comment: Title or caption for the attached file or document

EmbeddedFileBinaryObject.$comment: An electronic representation of the attachment encoded into text using Base64 content encoding. For more details on this encoding, see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Base64

Description.$comment: A description of the contents of the attached file or document to help a reader establish if this is the correct file before opening

CopyrightNotices.$comment: Text description of any legal or copyright notices that may apply to the file in question

DateTime.$comment: The date and time that this incident or event happened

Type.$comment: The date and time that this incident or event happened

Description.$comment: A description of the incident or event

LocationDescription.$comment: A narrative description of where the incident or event took place

DateTime.$comment: The date and time that this contact started

Transcript.$comment: A transcript of the communication - i.e. a verbatim transcription of the words written or spoken in a text (rather than image) format.

Comment.$comment: Additional comments or notes taken relating to this contact
